name: clay pit construction | clay pit infrastructure | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8826/documentation

This dataset represents the construction of 1 clay pit infrastructure. Data was based on an evaluation of an operating plant with an excavated amount of 100.000t/year.;This dataset is applied to a plant with a total produced amount per unit (50 years) of 4,000,000,000 kg (yearly production = 80,000,000 kg).;Data are estimated based on an air-picture and sketches of the process. The avarage yearly production volume is about 100'000 t, Total land occupation: 40'000m; about 20'000m2 buildings (1'000m2 multi storey and 19'000m2 hall), 15'000m2 paved roads, 5'000m2 vegetation. Assumed weight of machines: 2'000t and service life of 25 years.

From unoccupied land foreseen for a clay pit. Includes the area of the "build" infrastructure (buildings, roads, etc.) used for brick and roof tile production.

This activity ends with the constructed buildings and machineries for a clay pit. This dataset doesn't include the land-use of the mining activities.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects
tags: Sector: Infrastructure & Machinery; Resource Extraction; Minerals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: For some exchanges RER modules have been used as proxy
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The data of the infrastructure corresponds to the high level of technology
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography CH. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The estimation of land use and infrastructure relates to one company in Switzerland (Ziegelei Gasser AG in Rapperswil BE, with an excavated amount of 80.000t/y).

Estimation, based on a visit and an air photo of brickworks Gasser in Rapperswil BE. 5% of the roof area was assumed as multi-storage buildings, i.e. 1,000 m2 of surface. An average height of 6 m was assumed.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Estimation, based on a visit and an air photo of brickworks Gasser in Rapperswil BE. The required amount of infraestructure referring to the machines is based on the assumption that the total mass of all machines used for the production (including burning kiln, excluding the lining with refractory bricks) come to about 2,000 tons. The service life is assumed to be about 25 years.
